generic <typename TResult> public ref class CodeActivity abstract : System::Activities::Activity<TResult>

Docs.typeparam: The result returned by the activity.
Docs.summary: An abstract class for creating a custom activity with imperative behavior defined in the method, giving access to variable and argument resolution and extensions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Derived classes can define a result value of the type specified in the type specifier of the class.
## Examples The following example shows how to derive a class from <xref:System.Activities.CodeActivity%601>.
[!code-csharp[WorkflowInvoker#0](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/workflowinvoker/cs/add.cs#0)]

Docs.summary: When implemented in a derived class, creates an instance of the derived class.
Creates and validates a description of the activity's arguments, variables, child activities, and activity delegates.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Custom activity authors can provide validation logic in an activity's <xref:System.Activities.CodeActivity%601.CacheMetadata%2A> override. Any exceptions that are thrown from <xref:System.Activities.CodeActivity%601.CacheMetadata%2A> are not treated as validation errors. These exceptions will escape from the call to <xref:System.Activities.Validation.ActivityValidationServices.Validate%2A> and must be handled by the caller.

Docs.param: The activity's metadata that encapsulates the activity's arguments, variables, child activities, and activity delegates.
Docs.summary: Creates and validates a description of the activity's arguments, variables, child activities, and activity delegates.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The workflow runtime uses the default implementation of <xref:System.Activities.CodeActivity%601.CacheMetadata%2A> to ensure correct construction of a workflow as well as to manage run-time relationships and lifetime rules. The default implementation of <xref:System.Activities.CodeActivity%601.CacheMetadata%2A> examines the public members of the activity type using the type's <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. These public members are of type <xref:System.Activities.Argument>, <xref:System.Activities.Variable>, [IEnumerable\<Variable>](xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601), <xref:System.Activities.Activity>, [IEnumerable\<Activity>](xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601), or <xref:System.Activities.ActivityDelegate>. You can override this method to customize the building of the activity's run-time description and to provide custom validation logic. Any exceptions that are thrown from <xref:System.Activities.CodeActivity%601.CacheMetadata%2A> are not treated as validation errors. These exceptions will escape from the call to <xref:System.Activities.Validation.ActivityValidationServices.Validate%2A> and must be handled by the caller.

Docs.param: The execution context under which the activity executes.
Docs.summary: When implemented in a derived class, performs the execution of the activity.
Docs.returns: The result of the activity's execution.

member this.Implementation : Func<System.Activities.Activity> with get, set

remarks.format: ## Remarks Setting a value for this property returns a <xref:System.NotSupportedException>. <xref:System.Activities.CodeActivity%601> does not allow defining the execution logic as an activity. Instead the execution logic must be defined in the <xref:System.Activities.CodeActivity%601.Execute%2A> method.
